The Payroll Team is seeking an experienced Payroll Analyst to provide timely, accurate, and comprehensive payment for the US, Canada and Mexico.

ul.li: Overall understanding of payroll and post payroll process flows from the point of data capture through gross to net calculation

Processing and analyzing complex payments, non-cash fringe benefits/awards and related gross up, garnishments, tax withholding calculations and calculating workups for overpayments and retroactive pay
Experience developing and/or redesigning processes to maximize efficiency and effectiveness
Motivated self-starter who works well individually and in teams
Strong communication (written & verbal) and interpersonal skills
Good organizational and planning skills with strong attention to detail
Proficiency with spreadsheet, process mapping, and word processing tools
Ability to identify key stakeholders and successfully influence without authority
Previous experience working with an integrated systems environment, such as SAP and ADP required
Experience with ADP Global View preferred

div.p: • Provides high quality customer service to both internal and external groups • Analyzes and explains all components of Payroll • Integrates and prepares payroll data from incoming documents relating to Compensation, HR, Benefits and Taxation • Ensures all documentation is properly authorized and supported according to company policies, procedures, regulatory practices and legal requirements • Performs reconciliations and detailed audits to ensure accurate processing • Solves day-to-day operational problems of varied scope and complexity • Assists other payroll analysts when needed
• Qualifications are generally met by someone who has a technical Bachelor’s degree
